name: St. Pulcheria

locations.description: Byzantine empress who played a crucial role in the Council of Chalcedon

summary: Pulcheria was a Byzantine empress who played a crucial role in the Council of Chalcedon (451). She was the sister of Emperor Theodosius II and served as regent. She was a staunch defender of orthodoxy and worked closely with Pope Leo the Great to ensure the success of the Council of Chalcedon. She took a vow of virginity and was known for her piety and charitable works. She is venerated as a saint in the Eastern Orthodox Church.
